courseDescription.desc: Master both frontend and backend development
Hands-on projects with Angular and Spring Boot

course.overview: This course is designed to provide complete end-to-end training in Full Stack Development, covering everything from the front-end user interface to the back-end server and database management. You will learn to design, develop, test, and deploy robust and scalable web applications using industry-standard technologies. By the end of this course, you will be able to create full-fledged applications independently and be job-ready for Full Stack Developer roles.

whoShouldEnroll.enroll: Beginners who want to start a career in web development
Front-end developers looking to learn back-end development
Students, IT professionals, and career changers aiming for Full Stack roles

section.title: Back-End Development (Spring Boot)
section.lesson: Spring Boot Setup and REST APIs

question.q: What are the prerequisites for this course?
question.a: Basic knowledge of programming and databases is recommended, but not mandatory.
The course covers MySQL, PostgreSQL, and MongoDB with practical projects.

question.q: Will I get hands-on projects in both frontend and backend?
question.a: Yes, you will work on real projects using Angular for frontend and Spring Boot for backend.

question.q: Do I need prior experience in web development?
question.a: No, the course starts from basics and progresses to advanced full-stack concepts.

question.q: Are deployment platforms like AWS/Heroku covered?
question.a: Yes, you will learn deployment on platforms like AWS and Heroku.

course.overview: Automation testing is a critical skill in today’s software industry. This course introduces you to Selenium WebDriver, one of the most widely used tools for web automation. You’ll learn how to automate web applications across browsers, create reusable testing frameworks, and integrate your automation scripts with CI/CD pipelines like Jenkins. With hands-on exercises, you’ll build test cases for real-world projects and understand how to debug and maintain large test suites. The course emphasizes practical implementation, ensuring that by completion, you’ll be able to confidently work as a QA automation tester or test engineer.

whoShouldEnroll.enroll: Beginners in software testing or QA who want to learn automation
Manual testers aiming to transition to automation testing
Developers looking to understand automated testing workflows
IT professionals aspiring to become QA Automation Engineers

section.title: Introduction to Software Testing
section.lesson: Test Life Cycle and Test Case Design

question.q: Do I need prior programming knowledge?
question.a: Basic Java knowledge helps, but the course covers necessary Java concepts.
TestNG, JUnit, and Cucumber BDD are included.

question.q: Will I learn automation for web applications only?
question.a: No, you will also learn API automation and basics of mobile testing with Appium.
Yes, Selenium automation will be integrated with Jenkins and GitHub workflows.

question.q: Does the course include real-time projects?
question.a: Yes, industry-like automation projects are part of the curriculum.

course.overview: Java remains one of the most versatile and widely used programming languages. This course builds a strong foundation in Java syntax, object-oriented programming, exception handling, data structures, and multithreading. You’ll practice concepts using hands-on coding challenges and mini-projects in popular IDEs like Eclipse and IntelliJ. By learning Java, you not only prepare yourself for advanced frameworks like Spring and Hibernate but also gain skills essential for backend development, enterprise systems, and Android development. It’s the perfect starting point for anyone aiming for a long-term career in software engineering.

whoShouldEnroll.enroll: Beginners aiming to become professional Java developers
Programmers looking to strengthen Java fundamentals
Students and IT professionals preparing for Java-based roles
Anyone aiming for careers in backend, enterprise, or web development
